item.title: Dana White Reacts To Amanda Nunes' Retirement At UFC 289, Decides Fate Of Women's Featherweight Division
item.description: Amanda Nunes retired with her bantamweight and featherweight titles at UFC 289. This has left some big decisions for Dana White to make moving forward. Coming into UFC 289, Nunes was looking to defend her bantamweight title for the first time since regaining her belt from Julianna Pe√±a, who took it ...
item.dc:creator: Derek Hall
item.content:encoded:
Amanda Nunes retired with her bantamweight and featherweight titles at UFC 289. This has left some big decisions for Dana White to make moving forward.

Coming into UFC 289, Nunes was looking to defend her bantamweight title for the first time since regaining her belt from Julianna Pe√±a, who took it from her in a shocking upset. The two were even intended to have their third fight as the headlining bout for the UFC's return to Vancouver, but when a rib injury forced Pe√±a out, Irene Aldana stepped in.

#AndStill @Amanda_Leoa pic.twitter.com/WV6Rh31cIs

— danawhite (@danawhite) June 11, 2023

Dana White Likely Retiring Featherweight With Amanda Nunes

In the end, Amanda Nunes would completely dominate Irene Aldana, en route to a unanimous decision and defending the bantamweight title. Following the victory, she announced that she was retiring from the sport on top, while still holding belts at 135lb and 145lb.

Speaking to media after the event, UFC President Dana White said that he was not surprised to see Nunes walk away at this point, given the success she has had. Moreover, when asked about the future of the virtually non-existent featherweight division, he all-but confirmed that the division would retire with Amanda.

"I'm not shocked that she retired. I've been saying for awhile, she's made a lot of money and her life is a lot different than it was 10 years ago," White said (h/t Aaron Bronsteter. "Would I like to see her stick around and do some more? Absolutely! I love the kid. She's been incredible to work with, she's such a good human being and a great champion... But if she's ready to go, you've got to be happy for her."

Dana on Amanda's retirement: "I'm not shocked that she retired. I've been saying for awhile, she's made a lot of money and her life is a lot different than it was 10 years ago"

— Aaron Bronsteter (@aaronbronsteter) June 11, 2023

White says that the featherweight division is likely to retire with Amanda Nunes.

— Aaron Bronsteter (@aaronbronsteter) June 11, 2023

It is not entirely surprising to hear Dana White say that the women's fratherweight division will probably be dissolved with Amanda Nunes retiring, given the fact that across five years and three champions, there has never been a list of rankings for the division. It will be interesting to see if the UFC decides to replace it with another division in women's MMA; perhaps one with more established talent.

  • Read also: 'I Scared You Into Retirement' - Julianna Pena, Gilbert Burns, Aljamain Sterling & Others React To Amanda Nunes' Dominant UFC 289 Win & Retirement

item.title: Bantamweight Contender Sets Up Fight For Vacant Title After Amanda Nunes' Retirement At UFC 289
item.description: Following Amanda Nunes retirement at UFC 289, Raquel Pennington suggested the UFC should book a matchup for the vacant women‚Äôs bantamweight title featuring her and Julianna Pe√±a. UFC 289 was originally going to be headlined by a trilogy fight between Nunes and Pe√±a, but after ‚ÄúThe Venezuelan Vixen‚Äù ...
item.dc:creator: Drew Beaupr√©
item.content:encoded:
Following Amanda Nunes retirement at UFC 289, Raquel Pennington suggested the UFC should book a matchup for the vacant women‚Äôs bantamweight title featuring her and Julianna Pe√±a.

UFC 289 was originally going to be headlined by a trilogy fight between Nunes and Pe√±a, but after ‚ÄúThe Venezuelan Vixen‚Äù suffered a rib injury the #5-ranked Irene Aldana stepped up to challenge the champion. Mexican fighters had already experienced considerable success in UFC title fights this year, but Aldana never really managed to establish any momentum in the UFC 289 main event and ended up losing a lopsided unanimous decision.

There had been some speculation ahead of the event about Nunes potentially retiring with a win, and immediately after being handed her belts the Brazilian announced she was indeed going to be stepping away from the sport that she had dominated for so many years. 

Raquel Pennington Pitches Matchup For Vacant Title After Amanda Nunes Retires 

The #2-ranked Pennington made weight ahead of UFC 289 as the backup fighter for the card‚Äôs main event, and immediately after Nunes retired she jumped on Twitter to act as matchmaker for the women‚Äôs bantamweight division.

Me vs Julianna got the world title!!!! Dana always thought from TUF we would face each other at the finale. Wasn‚Äôt the journey then but here we are now!!! @danawhite @Mickmaynard2 @ufc

— Raquel Pennington (@RockyPMMA) June 11, 2023

"Me vs Julianna got the world title!!!! Dana always thought from TUF we would face each other at the finale. Wasn‚Äôt the journey then but here we are now!!! (Dana White) (Mick Maynard) (UFC)"

‚ÄúRocky‚Äù previously challenged Nunes for the women‚Äôs bantamweight title at UFC 224, but she was stopped in the fifth round and went on suffer another loss in her next fight against Germaine de Randamie. Following a loss to Holly Holm at UFC 246, Pennington has now won five-straight fights and most recently defeated Ketlen Vieira by split decision last January.

Nunes‚Äô retirement eliminates the chance of the Pe√±a trilogy being completed, but ‚ÄúThe Venezuelan Vixen‚Äù will still have a chance to reclaim the women‚Äôs bantamweight belt if she and Pennington face off for the vacant title. Pe√±a scored one of the biggest upsets in MMA history when she submitted Nunes at UFC 269, however she was soundly beaten when the two women met in an immediate rematch at UFC 277.

Read Also: Pennington On TUF Stint With Pe√±a: "Everybody Was Making Fun Of Her"

item.title: Bellator Standout Archie Colgan Looking To Make Statement With Win Over Emmanuel Sanchez [Exclusive]
item.description: Archie "King" Colgan's MMA career is off to an incredible start, as he has become one of the names to watch out for in the Bellator lightweight division. He began his amateur career at Sparta Combat League, defeating Julian Colon by knockout in the first round on Nov. 2, 2019. After earning ...
item.dc:creator: Tyriece Simon
item.content:encoded:
Archie "King" Colgan's MMA career is off to an incredible start, as he has become one of the names to watch out for in the Bellator lightweight division. He began his amateur career at Sparta Combat League, defeating Julian Colon by knockout in the first round on Nov. 2, 2019. After earning two more knockout wins in the amateurs, Colgan felt ready to be a professional fighter. He made his pro debut for Legacy Fighting Alliance against Andrew Claborn on March 19, 2021. 

Shaking off the nerves in the middle of his debut, he finished Claborn by knockout in the third round. "King's" first pro win pushed him to continue to try to finish any opponent he would face. Two years later, Colgan is undefeated with seven wins, five by knockout and one by submission. He made his way to Bellator in 2021 and quickly achieved ranked status in the lightweight division. 

At Bellator 297 on June 18, Colgan will face his most formidable challenge when he faces Emmanuel Sanchez. 

Colgan shared with MMA News that he wants to be the second man to finish Sanchez in his career and make a huge statement.

Here's the video of our discussion, followed by written highlights. 

Archie Colgan On Wanting To Finish Emmanuel Sanchez

Sanchez has been with Bellator since 2014 and is a real test for Colgan. The Bellator veteran has a successful career in the company and has fought for a title at featherweight and lightweight. However, he is on a four-fight losing streak and also suffered his first loss by submission against Patr√≠cio "Pitbull" Freire at Bellator 209 on April 2, 2021. While Colgan wants to get a win over the former title challenger, he also wants to be on the shortlist that can say they've finished Sanchez in MMA. 

"...I think this win over Emmanuel Sanchez coming up is going to be just a solid win to show that, yeah, I am that guy. I am here. He's not just beating guys who are his level or lower, like, yeah, he's able to finish the guys that were world title challengers. He's able to finish guys that, you know, haven't been finished. I think Emmanuel Sanchez has only been finished one time by guillotine by Patr√≠cio Pitbull, who is one of the greatest of all time in MMA. What are they going to say when Archie Colgan finishes him," said Colgan.

üëë ùóßùóµùó≤ ùóûùó∂ùóªùó¥

Impeccable striking from @king_colgan to secure the stoppage! #Bellator293 | Watch LIVE on @SHOsports pic.twitter.com/NbzCwmC7N5

— Bellator MMA (@BellatorMMA) April 1, 2023

He added that while his style tends to lead to a knockout, he'll also go for submission if the opportunity presents itself. 

"...I plan on being the second guy to finish him, maybe it's by submission, but if he, we'll see, but I plan on finishing him. I don't plan on going out there and making some crazy war, but I'm willing to do that. I'm down to bang, and if we gotta fight for 15 minutes and get dirty and grapple and come back up and get super tired and fatigued, it's just what it is, but I'm also willing to stop him, and I think I'm going to," said Colgan. 

A knockout or submission win over Sachez will be a huge accomplishment, but it could also set up a big fight for Colgan in his next fight. 

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Bellator MMA (@bellatormma)

What's Next With A Win Over Emmanuel Sanchez?

"King" hopes to get into title contention, but it won't happen for a while, even with a win over Sanchez. Bellator currently has the lightweight grand prix happening that could hold up the rest of the lightweight division until next year. 

Left out of the tournament, Corgan may have to contend with people outside of the rankings. However, "King" wouldn't mind taking on some matchup with unranked fighters that make sense. One name that he had an interest in fighting was Peter Queally. 

"...I think I'm in a good spot for an opportunity for guys like Emmanuel Sanchez, guys like Peter Queally. They have really good names and backing and have built-in good career for themselves, right? They are towards the end of their career, and they want to get all the notoriety that they can," said Colgan.

He shared that fighters like Sanchez may not think fighting him is an ideal matchup, but it's one of the opportunities they can get to enter the lightweight rankings. 

Colgan added, "...With this win over Emmanuel, you know if Bellator wants me to cross the pond, and I know they haven't put a date up for Mr. Queally in Sep. and I know they probably want him on that Dublin card in Sep., so yeah I'd cross the pond."

While a fight with Queally is intriguing, Colgan is focused on getting through Sanchez first. It may seem like "King" career is progressing fast, but he has shown that he is ready for the moment and will try to add another highlight reel finish at Bellator 297.

In the UFC's return to Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada, women's bantamweight gold was on the line as Nunes faced off against ...
item.dc:creator: Derek Hall
item.content:encoded:
Amanda Nunes successfully defended her title against Irene Aldana, in the main event of UFC 289. However, there were mixed reactions from those watching her do so.

In the UFC's return to Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada, women's bantamweight gold was on the line as Nunes faced off against Aldana. While the bout was initially supposed to be the rubber match between the champ and Julianna Pe√±a, an injury allowed for Aldana to step in, who many fans felt was the more deserving contender.

#AndStill @Amanda_Leoa pic.twitter.com/WV6Rh31cIs

— danawhite (@danawhite) June 11, 2023

Amanda Nunes Dominates Irene Aldana and Retires

In the end, Amanda Nunes would put on a dominant performance, earning a unanimous decision over the contender. Following the contest, "The Lioness" announced that she has decided to retire from the sport, leaving with both the bantamweight and featherweight titles.

Following the contest and announcement of her retirement, there were mixed reactions from fans to the way UFC 289 played out. While most were congratulatory towards Nunes, there were some who were not impressed with the entertainment level of her farewell fight.

"I scared you so bad into retirement. Personally, Congratulations. Professionally, wtf was that?" Julianna Pe√±a mocked on Twitter, adding, "Canadians don‚Äôt boo, they just walked out quietly before The fight was over #ufc289 #snoozefest #terrible #stinker #ducking"

item.title: 4 Positives & 3 Negatives From UFC 289: Amanda Nunes vs. Irene Aldana
item.description: On Saturday night, the mixed martial arts leader returned for its latest pay-per-view event, UFC 289. After a string of cards that were widely branded underwhelming on paper, what better way to follow it up than a numbered event seen in the same negative light ‚Äî this time for $79.99... Once again, ...
item.dc:creator: Harvey Leonard
item.content:encoded:
On Saturday night, the mixed martial arts leader returned for its latest pay-per-view event, UFC 289.

After a string of cards that were widely branded underwhelming on paper, what better way to follow it up than a numbered event seen in the same negative light ‚Äî this time for $79.99...

Once again, those who follow the view that the UFC's content is becoming considerably watered down had further ammunition owing to a PPV lineup that featured a distinct lack of big names and ranked contenders.

Nevertheless, there were a pair of major matchups put together for the promotion's return to Canada, including a crucial lightweight clash between former champion Charles Oliveira and Beneil Dariush in the co-main event. And they set the stage for the consensus greatest female mixed martial artist of all time, Amanda Nunes, who looked to stall Irene Aldana's plans to become the fourth active Mexican UFC titleholder.

With perennial entertainers Dan Ige and Nate Landwehr colliding, in addition to the next assignments for the host nation's own Mike Malott and promising middleweight Nassourdine Imavov, Saturday's card certainly had the potential for some thrilling action, in spite of its relatively lackluster slate.

But did that come to fruition? Let's find out with all the positives and negatives from UFC 289.

Tonight's FULL #UFC289 lineup ü§© Get your picks in!

[ Order the PPV on @ESPNPlus | B2YB @CryptoCom ] pic.twitter.com/JbMlQTYop6

— UFC (@ufc) June 10, 2023

Positive - Flyweight Continues To Strengthen

Well, how about that for making an impact on debut?

In the space of 15 minutes at UFC 289, Stephen Erceg went from Australia's relatively unknown leading flyweight prospect to a top 10 fighter on MMA's biggest stage.

Just weeks before crossing the world to debut in Canada, "AstroBoy" was still awaiting his first opportunity inside the Octagon. Thanks to Matt Schnell's late withdrawal, that came on short notice against #10-ranked contender David Dvo≈ô√°k.

After showing that he certainly belongs in the UFC throughout a close opening round, Erceg shone in the second, dropping his Czech counterpart with a head kick and seemingly coming close to a guillotine finish on the ground.

*A brief side note, round two in this contest marked a good demonstration of an often misunderstood element of the judging criteria. While Dvo≈ô√°k controlled the majority of the round on the feet with consistent lands, the criteria is firm in that "immediate" weighs more heavily than "cumulative" offense. In that regard, the impact of Erceg's strikes and near-finishes comfortably put his efforts above his opponent's.*

Following a another strong frame, the Australian newcomer did enough to earn the nod on all three scorecards. And in an already consistently entertaining flyweight division, the addition and impressive debut of a top prospect (and now contender) was a big positive.

This fight also marked the second consecutive event where a late-notice debutant has impressed against a top 10 foe, with Diego Lopes giving Movsar Evloev as much as he could handle at UFC 288 last month.

Underdogs rising to the occasion in their first Octagon outings on the PPV stage is certainly a trend I can get behind.

‚úÖ Fought on eight days notice
‚úÖ Beat a top-10 flyweight in his UFC debut

STEVE ERCEG HAS ARRIVED üëè #UFC289 pic.twitter.com/1b1hxpFZh0

— ESPN MMA (@espnmma) June 11, 2023

Positive - A Highlight For Canada

Okay, I'm going to grit my teeth and hope to get through this entry without a reference to Ariel Helwani...

After a number of entertaining decisions at UFC 289, one of the host country's own turned the heat up with a highlight reel knockout in front of his home crowd. That fighter was Aiemann Zahabi, who lit up Rogers Arena during the preliminary card.

The Quebec native has always been known as a patient and composed fighter, something that can't be said for his opponent on Saturday, Aoriqileng. The "Mongolian Murderer" has a penchant for bursting out the gates and setting a relentless pace.

The question on fight night was who would impose their game best?

Well, as it turned out, the answer was Zahabi imposing Aoriqileng's...

After threatening with an early burst, the 35-year-old Canadian repeated the somewhat surprising act of aggression to close the show after just 64 seconds. The damage came from a brutal left hook, with a few subsequent ground-and-pound strikes confirming the stoppage.

There's nothing like a knockout from a home favorite to get the crowd going, and Zahabi was responsible for just that at UFC 289.

We can no doubt look forward to hearing about the finish when he hosts The MMA Hour on Monday (damnit, I was so close...).

AIEMANN ZAHABI WITH THE FIRST KNOCKOUT OF THE NIGHT!! üëäüá®üá¶ #UFC289 pic.twitter.com/Gc6l54aGg8

— UFC (@ufc) June 11, 2023

Negative - A Tough Break

And everything was going so well...

Up until the featured contest, the UFC 289 prelims had delivered a thoroughly entertaining set of matchups. Unfortunately, the most anticipated contest on that portion of the card didn't get to follow suit.

The middleweight clash between Nassourdine Imavov and Chris Curtis was one of few pairings with ranking implications in Vancouver on Saturday. Ultimately, neither man was able to enhance their standing on the 185-pound ladder after an accidental clash of heads rendered "The Action Man" unable to continue.

This was a negative for all parties, from the two fighters to the fans in attendance. It's hard to describe how much of a tough break this was for Curtis, in particular, who has now come off worse from headbutts in two consecutive bouts. For Imavov, meanwhile, he saw his trek across the Atlantic and strong start inside the Octagon go to waste owing to an inadvertent incident.

After such a good start to the event, the disappointing end to the featured prelim certainly stalled the momentum heading into the PPV card.

Chris Curtis was pleading for the fight to continue. Warrior. #UFC289 pic.twitter.com/SQjCfuZAqI

— UFC (@ufc) June 11, 2023

Negative - Too Close For Comfort

When I envisioned possible negatives that could come from UFC 289, a host of fans falling out the stand during a walkout probably wouldn't have cracked the 100 most likely...

Somehow, someway, that actually happened.

When Canada's Mike Malott began his walkout, a group of fans clamoring for a high five got closer to their man than they'd have hoped for ‚Äî a sentiment that can also be applied in regards to the concrete floor.

In all seriousness, this was nasty, and the fact that no one was left seriously injured was massively fortunate. Understandably, some questions will no doubt be directed at the venue. After all, spectators leaning on the railings during a fighter's walkout is hardly unexpected.

Initially, the incident even appeared serious enough for a potential pause in the action ‚Äî is it smart to have a fight begin while medical personnel may be required in the crowd? Daniel Cormier's jovial reaction and giggle upon hearing of the moment also seemed questionable.

Thankfully, I'm not writing about severe injuries, but nonetheless, such an incident isn't nice to see. It also took away from the early goings of Malott and Adam Fugitt's fight as most were left concerned for those vaulted from the stand.

This could have been disastrous pic.twitter.com/Z4oZsVvIXZ

— Ariel Helwani (@arielhelwani) June 11, 2023

Positive - A "Proper" Showing

While Malott's appearance on home soil began with concern owing to the walkout incident, it ended in jubilation for him and his fellow Canadians.

In addition to ensuring that his nation's fighters went a perfect 5-0 on the night in Vancouver, "Proper" maintained his 100 percent finishing rate inside the Octagon with a third consecutive triumph.

After recording a memorable submission of Yohan Lainesse earlier this year, Malott put his grappling talents back on display at UFC 289, a skillset that he also used in his contract-winning performance on Dana White's Contender Series.

Having dropped Fugitt with a brutal combination on the feet, Malott locked in a tight guillotine choke for the tap.

Suffice to say, the Canadian's latest victory has firmly cemented him as the latest promising prospect at 170 pounds, and a significant number of eyeballs will certainly be on him when he makes the walk again.

Mike Mallot looked phenomenal tonight! Canada goes undefeated on the night. #UFC289 pic.twitter.com/sDDUa1ELVA

— MMANews (@mmanews_com) June 11, 2023

Positive - "Do Bronx"

I really thought that a Charles Oliveira win would be a negative, purely in the context of how it leaves the lightweight division.

In the end, "Do Bronx" delivered a memorable bounce-back performance, and I just can't put it down as anything but a positive.

On paper, like many, I've long seen Beneil Dariush as one of the biggest threats to Islam Makhachev, That, combined with a limited interest in seeing Oliveira and the Russian champion run it back, left me seeing a win and guaranteed first title shot for the Iranian-born American as the desired outcome.

But a vintage display from Oliveira? Yeah, that's not bad either.

Following a competitive period on the ground, the Brazilian closed the show on the feet before the end of the opening frame. After flooring Dariush with an overhand right behind the ear, "Do Bronx" forced Jason Herzog to step in with some vicious ground-and-pound strikes.

One thing I didn't expect to come from UFC 289 was a strong interest in Makhachev vs. Oliveira 2. Well, consider me intrigued. And if the alternate is either Dustin Poirier or Justin Gaethje, consider me firmly behind the former champ.

Oh, and if it needs saying, Oliveira is a star ‚Äî his post-fight interview proved that and then some.

Not going anywhere. #UFC289 pic.twitter.com/ZfkMbhzIBJ

— UFC (@ufc) June 11, 2023

Negative - Disappointingly Uncompetitive 

I really thought Irene Aldana had a shot at dethroning Amanda Nunes. If not victorious, I thought she'd make it a somewhat close affair in defeat, and at the very least attempt to do so.

In the, however, Aldana's performance was far from competitive in the UFC 289 main event. Across the entirety of 25 minutes, the Mexican held a high guard ‚Äî oh, how I wish that wasn't the end of the sentence.

The gun-shy Aldana was effectively battered on the feet, a scenario that seemed unlikely ahead of time owing to her skilful boxing ability. Despite her credentials, though, "Robles" did nothing to earn the respect of the champion, and nothing that resembled a motivated title challenger pursuing championship glory.

The Guadalajara-based fighter essentially performed similar to Yoel Romero against Israel Adesanya in 2020. Unlike "The Last Stylebender," however, Nunes didn't match that lack of output and instead teed off, treating Aldana like a punching bag.

For what had been an entertaining main card, the main event wasn't the conclusion anyone would have hoped for. Although I was fairly pleased to see Nunes' trilogy with Julianna Pe√±a collapse and Aldana get the shot instead, at least "The Venezuelan Vixen" would have left it all in there.

In the aftermath, Nunes announced her retirement. On one hand, it seems like a slightly underwhelming fight to leave the sport on the back of. But on the other, another show of utter dominance is perhaps the appropriate way for the women's GOAT to depart.

The Lioness DOMINATES all 5 rounds in this one ü¶Å #UFC289 pic.twitter.com/7dEyFi5C3v

— UFC (@ufc) June 11, 2023
  • Read Also: UFC 289: Amanda Nunes vs. Irene Aldana Results & Highlights

Landwehr has quickly become a fan-favorite after debuting for the UFC in 2020, and a three-fight win streak earned him a main card slot opposite Ige at ...
item.dc:creator: Drew Beaupr√©
item.content:encoded:
Belal Muhammad wasn‚Äôt impressed by the coaching that Colby Covington‚Äôs teammate Nate Landwehr received during his fight with Dan Ige at UFC 289.

Landwehr has quickly become a fan-favorite after debuting for the UFC in 2020, and a three-fight win streak earned him a main card slot opposite Ige at UFC 289. The matchup was an opportunity for ‚ÄúThe Train‚Äù to jump into the UFC‚Äôs featherweight rankings, but the gutsy performance he put on wasn‚Äôt enough to avoid losing a decision on the judges‚Äô scorecards.

Muhammad is often active on social media while watching UFC events, and ‚ÄúRemember the Name‚Äù called out Landwehr‚Äôs coaches for the advice they were providing after the featherweight had been knocked down twice by Ige.

Ur guy just got rocked I don‚Äôt think saying‚Äù it‚Äôs ok he‚Äôs getting tired ‚Äú is good advice right now

— Belal Muhammad (@bullyb170) June 11, 2023

‚ÄúUr guy just got rocked I don‚Äôt think saying‚Äô it‚Äôs okay he‚Äôs getting tired ‚Äò is good advice right now"

Belal Muhammad Still Angling For Fight With Colby Covington

Another Twitter user was quick to point out that Landwehr trains out of MMA Masters and has the same coaches as Covington, which Muhammad was happy to acknowledge.

I know it‚Äôs a preview of when I fight him ü§ì https://t.co/wUP7QT4qqf

— Belal Muhammad (@bullyb170) June 11, 2023

‚ÄúI know it‚Äôs a preview of when I fight him‚Äù

There‚Äôd already be enough reason for Muhammad and Covington to want to fight given that they‚Äôre two of the UFC‚Äôs top-ranked welterweights, but the pair have also gone back-and-forth with one another after ‚ÄúChaos‚Äù threatened UFC commentator Jon Anik for his apparent support of Muhammad.

Covington is supposedly going to be the next challenger for UFC Welterweight Champion Leon Edwards, but so far there‚Äôs been very little news on if that fight will actually come together.

Muhammad is actively campaigning for his own chance at the welterweight title after extending his win streak to nine fights by defeating Gilbert Burns at UFC 288, and there‚Äôs no doubt he‚Äôd love to step into the cage with a former interim champion in Covington.

Read Also: Belal Muhammad Follows Floyd Mayweather Approach To Striking: "There's A Life After Fighting:

item.title: 'Top 3 For Greatest Lightweight Fighter Of All Time' - Islam Makhachev, Sean O'Malley, Belal Muhammad & Others React To Charles Oliveira's Statement Win At UFC 289

The matchup between top lightweights was originally meant to take place at UFC 288 before an Oliveira injury pushed it to UFC 289, where it was ...
item.dc:creator: Drew Beaupr√©
item.content:encoded:
Charles Oliveira‚Äôs first non-title fight since 2020 saw the Brazilian score a fantastic finish against Beneil Dariush in the co-main event of UFC 289.

The matchup between top lightweights was originally meant to take place at UFC 288 before an Oliveira injury pushed it to UFC 289, where it was given co-main event status before the women‚Äôs bantamweight title fight between Amanda Nunes and Irene Aldana.

Easily the most-anticipated fight of the entire card for many fans, Dariush entered the bout on an incredible eight-fight win streak and was hoping a victory over the former lightweight champion might book his first chance at UFC gold. ‚ÄúBenny‚Äù had moments of success in the opening few minutes of the fight, but late in the first round Oliveira dropped the 34-year-old and rained down punches to close things out.

Oliveira finishes Dariush in Round 1 üò≥ #UFC289 pic.twitter.com/cy8uiZ3wLz

— ESPN MMA (@espnmma) June 11, 2023

Following the win Oliveira will likely turn his attention to the UFC 291 matchup between Justin Gaethje and Dustin Poirier, as the winner of that fight would be the only potential obstacle to a rematch with UFC Lightweight Champion Islam Makhachev.

ALL THE EMOTIONS FOR CHARLES OLIVEIRA üëè #UFC289 pic.twitter.com/sUwILbOeUd

— SportsCenter (@SportsCenter) June 11, 2023

MMA Twitter Reacts To Charles Oliveira's Win At UFC 289

All the eyes of the MMA world were focused on the UFC 289 matchup between Oliveira and Dariush, and there were plenty of reactions to the incredible finish that ‚Äúdo Bronx‚Äù pulled off in the first round. 

Want to know how to blow a title shot faster than Corey Sandhagen?

Watch the interview that is about to take place‚Ä¶

— Chael Sonnen (@ChaelSonnen) June 11, 2023

"You want me to fight him in his house? I'll go. I'm ready."

- Oliveira on fighting Islam next in Abu Dhabi

— Ariel Helwani (@arielhelwani) June 11, 2023

Incredible performance üëèüèΩüëèüèΩüëèüèΩ @UFCEspanol @ufc #UFC289

— Tracy Cortez‚Äôs ERA (@TracyCortezmma) June 11, 2023

CHARLES OLIVEIRA as the underdog here was too crazy üíØ #UFC289

— Derek Brunson (@DerekBrunson) June 11, 2023

Gutted for Dariush. Should‚Äôve had a title shot already. But congrats on a HUGE statement from Oliveira! He is a bonafide finisher! #UFC289

— Aljamain Sterling (@funkmasterMMA) June 11, 2023

Congrats Charles.
But still there‚Äôs levels in this game üòé

Head up Benny you the man

Charles speaks English now?! What can't this man do??

— Ariel Helwani (@arielhelwani) June 11, 2023

Woooooow

Man Charles got bricks in his hands

— Belal Muhammad (@bullyb170) June 11, 2023

Charles so Fuckin fun to watch!

Ugh I love him #UFC289

— Casey Oneill (@kingcaseymma) June 11, 2023

Charles Oliveira is in the top 3 for greatest lightweight fighter of all time and he has plenty of tread left on his tires‚Ä¶‚Ä¶#UFC289

— Michael Chiesa (@MikeMav22) June 11, 2023

Goddamn what a fucking beast!

— Angela Hill (@AngieOverkill) June 11, 2023

What an amazing performance and exactly how you bounce back from a tough loss. Charles is an inspiration to all fighters out there. #UFC289

— Anthony Smith (@lionheartasmith) June 11, 2023

Good job @CharlesDoBronxs

item.title: Railing Break Causes Fans To Fall Over During Mike Malott's Walkout At UFC 289, Jon Anik Addresses Mishap On Air
item.description: UFC 289 saw a breakout performance from Canada's own Mike Mallott. However, he was not the only person breaking out in the arena. Mallott was looking to have his homecoming moment at UFC 289, competing in his home country of Canada. It was clear that he had the UFC's faith too, as they put him on a ...
item.dc:creator: Derek Hall
item.content:encoded:
UFC 289 saw a breakout performance from Canada's own Mike Mallott. However, he was not the only person breaking out in the arena.

Mallott was looking to have his homecoming moment at UFC 289, competing in his home country of Canada. It was clear that he had the UFC's faith too, as they put him on a UFC pay-per-view main card in just his third fight with the promotion.

Mike Malott Brings Down The House

In the end, Mike Malott would get the job done in a big way, finishing Adam Fugitt with a guillotine choke in the second round. This bout marked just the second time he had been out of the first round in his 12-fight pro career, and maintained his 100% finishing rate as a fighter.

However, what had people talking after the fact, was what happened when Malott walked out to the Octagon. Users on Twitter couldn't help but point out how fans were pushing on the railing to lean over and touch their hometown hero, only for the railing to break and several fans to fall on the ground in front of the fighter.

Mike Malott just broke the arena with his walkout @Michael_Malott canada can‚Äôt contain themselves #UFC289 @ufc #Vancouver pic.twitter.com/4FgSbDygEk

— ShirtGuyLee (@ShirtGuyMMA) June 11, 2023

Clearly the fans could not contain themselves or their excitement to see Malott compete. For those worrying about the health and safety of the fans, Jon Anik was quick to point out on the broadcast, that everyone was alright, with Paul Felder following up to offer the following advice for compensation.

"Just give them a beer. Canadians are tough," he quipped.

In the end, this was a breakout performance from Mike Malott, who appears to have the full momentum of the UFC promotional machine behind him. It will be interesting to see what comes next for this clearly popular Canadian prospect.

  • Read also: UFC 289: Amanda Nunes vs. Irene Aldana Results & Highlights

item.title: Chris Curtis Provides Update On Nasty Cut After UFC 289 No Contest, Sean Strickland Weighs In
item.description: The unfortunate luck of Chris Curtis continued at UFC 289, when he fought Nassourdine Imavov. Following the no contest outcome, "Action Man" has given his reaction. Curtis was making a quick turnaround at UFC 289, competing just two months after losing a close decision in a Fight of the Night ...
item.dc:creator: Derek Hall
item.content:encoded:
The unfortunate luck of Chris Curtis continued at UFC 289, when he fought Nassourdine Imavov. Following the no contest outcome, "Action Man" has given his reaction.

Curtis was making a quick turnaround at UFC 289, competing just two months after losing a close decision in a Fight of the Night against Kelvin Gastelum. He was frustrated with the outcome of this fight, which he claimed was only scored in favor of his opponent due to accidental headbutt that dropped him, going unnoticed by the referee.

Chris Curtis, Sean Strickland React to No Contest at UFC 289

Looking to get the bad taste of defeat out of his mouth, Chris Curtis returned to action against Nassourdine Imavov at UFC 289. However, in a twist of bitter irony, he would once again get hit with an accidental clash of heads, with the resulting cut leaving him unable to see well enough to continue, resulting in the bout being called a no contest.

Following this disappointing result, Curtis took to his Instagram to react to the setback and unlucky situation. Here, he revealed the full extent of the damage he took from the headbutt and apologized to fans for the way things played out.

"10 stitches and possible Corneal abrasion. Sorry guys... seriously, I've never not been able to continue.

I'm sorry Canada, you guys have always been my biggest backers and I really wanted to put on a show. be back. Promise," wrote Curtis.

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Christopher Curtis (@actionman513)

Also taking time to react to this fight, was friend and teammate of Curtis, fellow UFC middleweight Sean Strickland. Taking to Twitter, Strickland had a simple reaction, but shared a close up photo of the gnarly cut.

"Goddamn....." Strickland wrote.

Goddamn..... pic.twitter.com/99TRiHQfeT

— Sean Strickland (@SStricklandMMA) June 11, 2023

This was certainly not the outcome that Chris Curtis or Nassourdine Imavov wanted for this contest. Some have suggested rebooking the fight for UFC Paris, and it will be interesting to see if that is the direction the UFC will head in.

  • Read also: UFC 289: Amanda Nunes vs. Irene Aldana Results & Highlights

item.title: Israel Adesanya Names Retired Fighter, Heavyweight Contender, & Welterweight Prospect Among The Best Strikers In UFC
item.description: Israel Adesanya is arguably the best striker to ever compete in the UFC, but there‚Äôs at least a few fighters that have managed to impress him with their standup skills. The 33-year-old is coming off what might have been the biggest win of his career after he finally defeated his longtime rival Alex ...
item.dc:creator: Drew Beaupr√©
item.content:encoded:
Israel Adesanya is arguably the best striker to ever compete in the UFC, but there‚Äôs at least a few fighters that have managed to impress him with their standup skills.

The 33-year-old is coming off what might have been the biggest win of his career after he finally defeated his longtime rival Alex Pereira in the main event of UFC 287. Pereira had previously defeated Adesanya twice in kickboxing before taking his middleweight title in their first MMA bout, but ‚ÄúThe Last Stylebender‚Äù stopped the Brazilian in the second round of their immediate rematch.

Adesanya is now waiting to see who the first challenger of his second title reign will be, with many fans expecting the winner of the upcoming UFC 290 matchup between Dricus du Plessis and Robert Whittaker to receive the next middleweight title shot.

Israel Adesanya Names Some Of His Favorite Strikers In MMA 

‚ÄúThe Last Stylebender‚Äù recently had some time to sit down with Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu World Champion Craig Jones, and when asked if he was impressed by any of the current strikers in MMA he provided a few notable examples.

‚ÄúZabit [Magomedsharipov] was one,‚Äù Adeanya answered. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs retired now‚Ä¶That was the first one that jumped to my head. Ciryl Gane ‚Äì f***ing love the way he moves, I love the striking. But it‚Äôs not just about being effective. There‚Äôs a lot of people that are effective, but this is mixed martial arts. Martial arts. Arts. I like something that when I watch it, it makes me feel a way. Like ‚ÄòWow, I‚Äôm amazed.‚Äô Like it makes me ‚Äì evokes some kind of emotion out of me. So when I watch guys like Ciryl Gane‚Ä¶Yair [Rodriguez] is another one, his last fight I was really impressed by the way he was moving and stuff‚Ä¶Ian Garry. Yeah, cause f***. Song Kenan, that combo he finished him off with, beautiful.‚Äù

Gane‚Äôs striking skills carried him to a 10-0 record and the UFC‚Äôs interim heavyweight title before coming up short in his bids to become the outright champion against Francis Ngannou and Jon Jones. Rodriguez claimed the promotion‚Äôs interim featherweight belt with a submission at UFC 284 but is well-respected as one of the most entertaining strikers in the UFC, and he‚Äôll have a chance to unify the featherweight titles when he meets Alexander Volkanovski at UFC 290.

Adesanya‚Äôs mention of Magomedsharipov is also a huge compliment considering the 32-year-old last fought in 2019, although he was one of the hotter prospects in the UFC prior to his unexpected retirement. One talented striker that doesn‚Äôt appear to be exiting the sport anytime soon is Garry, who is only 25 years old and already has five UFC victories since joining the promotion in 2021.

Read Also: Israel Adesanya Speaks Out About Old Sparring Encounter With Dricus Du Plessis 

Please provide transcription credit with a link to this article if you use any of these quotes.

media:content.media:description: Adesanya is one of the best strikers to ever compete in the UFC's Octagon. (Stephen R. Sylvanie/USA TODAY Sports)

item.title: Wild World of Fighting: Anderson Silva's Secret Fight, Michael Jackson Does Boxing, & More
item.description: The rumors are true ‚Äî the Wild World of Fighting is back, returning as the only series that has mastered the fistic arts. This week, we get insight into the secret identity of Anderson Silva, a toddler with Justin Gaethje level leg kicks, and more. So get your chin down and your hands up, and go a ...
item.dc:creator: Derek Hall
item.content:encoded:
The rumors are true ‚Äî the Wild World of Fighting is back, returning as the only series that has mastered the fistic arts.

This week, we get insight into the secret identity of Anderson Silva, a toddler with Justin Gaethje level leg kicks, and more. So get your chin down and your hands up, and go a few rounds with the Wild World of Fighting.

Never Too Early to Break Legs

Getting children involved in martial arts at an early age can be beneficial for a variety of different reasons. Not only is this a great source of physical fitness, but it can also provide an outlet for kids who want to find ways to better themselves.

As it turns out, putting kids in martial arts also results in those kids becoming little badasses as their skills develop. Take for example, this video posted by Karate Combat, which shows a toddler landing some leg kicks that are so powerful, they have Conor McGregor, Anderson Silva, and Chris Weidman shaking with nerves, while Justin Gaethje and Edison Barboza look on proudly, before adding a head kick for good measure.

Who taught this baby how to kick?!! pic.twitter.com/3zpOvhbe0m

— Karate Combat (@KarateCombat) June 6, 2023

That child is still wearing diapers, but he already has the skills and techniques to beat up at least 75% of adults. One thing is for sure; nobody is turning off Cocomelon until that kid says so.

Looks Like Tornado Weather

As the 1996 masterpiece Twister has shown you, tornados can appear at any time to wreck havock on a town. However, in the Wild World of Fighting, we fear a different kind of tornado.

Street fights can deliver some insane techniques from the most unsuspecting of people, and that was once again the case with our next entry. Here, in what may be the sketchiest parking lot of all time, a man was able to land a beautiful tornado kick to the face of his unsuspecting foe.

Bro Really Landed A Tornado Kick üëÄ pic.twitter.com/p01tBUxCMS

— TopStreetFights Ó®Ä (@TSFights) May 31, 2023

Props to the guy for eating that kick, getting back up, and trying to fight. Although wherever the rest of the footage is, it likely did not go well for that guy after taking such a serious blow to the head.

When Your Black Belt Doesn't Help

We now transition from an awesome street fight moment, to one that comes with a side of secondhand embarrassment. Warning, this next clip is not for the faint of heart.

While the reason for the fight is unclear, video was making the rounds recently, showing a fight between two guys, where one poor soul was unable to prevent his pants and underwear from falling completely down.

Two guys fighting while one of their pants are falling down ü§£ pic.twitter.com/FaA4MAnNme

— Detect Fights üíï (@detectfights) June 9, 2023

Sheesh, the only thing more embarrassing than your pants falling down during a street fight, is falling on top of a guy you're fighting, while his pants are down. The craziest part? He was wearing a belt the whole time.

The King of Pop(ping a Jab)

It has been said, especially in the boxing side of the Wild World of Fighting, that having proper footwork and movement in a fight is akin to dancing. Using that logic, had he applied himself, it is possible that Michael Jackson could have become the greatest defensive boxer of his era.

Luckily, you need not use only your imagination to picture what that would have looked like. A viral video shows what the King of Pop might have done, had he focused on the sweet science.

I‚Äôm so done üíÄüòÇüíÄüòÇüíÄüòÇüíÄüòÇüíÄüòÇüòÇ pic.twitter.com/HruUf9G7HZ

— justasisterfromthechi (@justasisterfro2) June 8, 2023

It is hard to decide what is most impressive, between this guy's impression of Michael Jackson and his actual boxing skill. It won't be long before we see Not Michael Jackson vs Not Logan Paul in a YouTube boxing match.

Anderson Silva Has A Secret Identity

A few weeks ago, the Wild World of Fighting discussed the MMA return of Spider-man, who appeared in his first fight since beating Batman and Robin, to take out Superman. Channeling our inner J. Jonah Jameson, we have discovered who is under the mask for the wall crawler.

None other than former UFC middleweight champion Anderson Silva was behind this Spider-MMAn (had to slip in that pun), and we have video proof. Check out the scene, as he was spotted trying to hide his mask.

This is the best Anderson Silva meme I've seen pic.twitter.com/IREPFu0ob1

— ùôíùôäùôâùòøùôÄùôçùòΩùôçùôÄùòºùòø üá¶üá∫ (@WonderbreadMMA) June 3, 2023

Honestly, with a nickname like "The Spider," we should have all seen this coming. I used to mock people for not realizing Clark Kent and Superman are identical, but here I am in the same boat.

With that, we close the book on this week's Wild World of Fighting. Tune in next week to see what other fighters are moonlighting as superheroes but are still fighting for money.

  • Read also: Wild World of Fighting: Alex Pereira Meets A Virgin, Tito Ortiz Praises Gregor McConor, & More

item.title: Video: UFC 289 Fighter Doesn't Realize Bout Is Over Following Brutal Knockout
item.description: The UFC 289 prelims kicked off with a bang, with the first bout ending in just over a minute. However, the losing fight had no idea that the bout was over. The main event for UFC 289 will see double champion Amanda Nunes look to defend her bantamweight strap against Irene Aldana live on ...
item.dc:creator: Derek Hall
item.content:encoded:
The UFC 289 prelims kicked off with a bang, with the first bout ending in just over a minute. However, the losing fight had no idea that the bout was over.

The main event for UFC 289 will see double champion Amanda Nunes look to defend her bantamweight strap against Irene Aldana live on pay-per-view. Before that, was a preliminary card airing on ESPN+, which was kicked off with a bantamweight contest between the younger brother of legendary coach Firas Zahabi, Aiemann Zahabi taking on Qileng Aori.

Aiemann Zahabi Knocked Qileng Aori From His Senses

It did not take long for things to heat up between Zahabi and Aori, with the bantamweights swinging early. Then, just 64 seconds into the contest, Zahabi would land a massive punch that sent Aori to the canvas, knocking him unconscious.

As impressive as the knockout was, that was not the only thing that got fans talking. After the fight was called off, Aori appeared to be knocked so far from his consciousness, that he did not even realize the fight was over, raising his fists and seeming to be preparing to fight again.

Wowpic.twitter.com/dysnfEdsDa

— Jed I. Goodman ¬© (@jedigoodman) June 11, 2023

While it is definitely not uncommon to see fighters not realize a ref is stopping a fight, continuing to grapple the referee when they are returning to consciousness, it is not often to see a fighter make their way back to their feet and still try to fight after being knocked out cold. Add that to the fact that the cage was filled with officials by that point, and it seems clear that Aiemann Zahabi likely gave Qileng Aori a pretty big concussion.

Stay tuned to MMA News for the latest news and updates from UFC 289.

  • Read also: UFC 289: Amanda Nunes vs. Irene Aldana Results & Highlights (7 PM ET)

item.title: Ant√¥nio 'Bigfoot' Silva Reacts After Suffering 11th Straight Defeat In Retirement Bout
item.description: Ant√≥nio "Bigfoot" Silva fought for the 35th, and supposedly final, time in the headlining bout of the inaugural Kingdom Fighting event. Unfortunately, things did not go according to plan for the Brazilian legend. It has been a rough road for Silva in the last several years, winning only 1 of his ...
item.dc:creator: Derek Hall
item.content:encoded:
Ant√≥nio "Bigfoot" Silva fought for the 35th, and supposedly final, time in the headlining bout of the inaugural Kingdom Fighting event. Unfortunately, things did not go according to plan for the Brazilian legend.

It has been a rough road for Silva in the last several years, winning only 1 of his last 8 in the UFC, with all of his losses coming by way of knockout or TKO. From there, he has continued to fight in various smaller promotions, but has still been unable to score a win since besting Soa Palelei in 2015.

Bigfoot Silva Loses Retirement Fight

After suffering yet another knockout loss to Oleg Popov at MMA Series 53, Bigfoot Silva decided to try both kickboxing and boxing, again coming up short in both bouts. He then decided to return to the world of MMA for what he says would be his retirement fight, much to the relief of fans who felt he should have retired long ago.

That apparently final fight came at Kingdom Fighting 1, where he faced off against Salim El Ouassaidi. Although he managed to avoid getting finished, the former UFC fighter still lost a decision in this main event contest, with a clip of the fight being posted to Twitter by Caposa.

Salim El Ouassaidi defeats Bigfoot Silva by decision in the Kingdom Fighting 1 main event. This marks Silva's 11th consecutive loss across four sports stemming back to 2015. pic.twitter.com/TClOcnCEMY

— caposa (@Grabaka_Hitman) June 10, 2023

After the fight, Silva placed his gloves in the cage and bowed to them, signifying his retirement. He also posted to Instagram to seemingly confirm that this was the end of the fighting chapter of his life.

" Thanks God for everything you do in my professional life.. Done üëçüèæüí™üèæüëäüèæ" wrote Silva, before adding in Portuguese, "Thank God for everything, today say goodbye to MMA after 19 years in a very tough fight with the 25-year-old athlete, we got out in a beating for 3 rounds and in the end he took it by decision. I finish my career very happy for everything I've achieved for almost 2 decades, thank first to God, to @alexdavismma @danlambertatt @eliwanderley and @mariosukata for everything they've done in my professional life.." 

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Antonio Silva (@bigfootsilva)

It should be noted that, while Bigfoot Silva has said this will be his last fight, this is not the first time the Brazilian has said he was hanging up his gloves, only to return to action just a few short months later. Hopefully he will stick to it this time, as there is a serious question to be had about how he is able to constantly be licensed by athletic commissions, despite his record in the last several years.

  • Read also: Watch: Antonio "Bigfoot" Silva KO'd Standing In Boxing Debut

item.title: Conor McGregor Sent Denver Nuggets Mascot To ER Following Viral Beatdown
item.description: While the situation that saw Conor McGregor punching the Denver Nuggets mascot was clearly staged, the former UFC champ-champ appeared to have taken things a bit too far. McGregor has been gearing up for a return to the Octagon, after breaking his leg in brutal fashion against Dustin Poirier, with ...
item.dc:creator: Derek Hall
item.content:encoded:
While the situation that saw Conor McGregor punching the Denver Nuggets mascot was clearly staged, the former UFC champ-champ appeared to have taken things a bit too far.

McGregor has been gearing up for a return to the Octagon, after breaking his leg in brutal fashion against Dustin Poirier, with hope surrounding a fight between he and Michael Chandler, following the pair coaching the current season of The Ultimate Fighter. However, he was recently seen in a different kind of fight, battering Denver Nuggets mascot Burnie in a video that has since gone viral.

Conor McGregor KO'd the Heat mascot üòÖ #NBAFinals pic.twitter.com/IRAKzuMKp2

— SportsCenter (@SportsCenter) June 10, 2023

Conor McGregor Sent Burnie to the ER

Some watching this moment during the Nuggets vs Heat game last night, may have noticed that it seemed like Conor McGregor punched the mascot a bit too hard for what was meant to be an advertisement for McGregor's pain relief spray. According to reports from The Athletic, that is exactly the case.

Apparently, McGregor was meant to hit Burnie enough to connect, simply so the Irishman could spray him with the pain relief spray. However, he hit the mascot so hard, that the person underneath the mask was sent to the ER, where he was treated after it was deemed medically necessary.

Conor McGregor is in Miami for game 4 üèÄ pic.twitter.com/16qypzDJRV

— Chamatkar Sandhu (@SandhuMMA) June 10, 2023

It is unclear where this skit went wrong, whether it was the initial punch that sent Burnie to the ground, or the probably unnecessary follow-up shot to the grounded mascot. Either way, Conor McGregor did not seem to be too fazed or bothered, as he stayed and watched the entire game, which saw the Denver Nuggets score a big win in Game 4 of the NBA Finals, when the Miami Heat lost to them with a score of 108-95. 

  • Read also: Conor McGregor Describes "Good, Solid Fighter" He Has Brought In Specifically To Train For Michael Chandler Bout

item.title: 'This Is F'n Crazy' ‚Äî Dwayne Johnson Offers Help To UFC Fighter With Only $7 In Bank Account Before A Fight
item.description: Dwayne Johnson has had a bit of a complicated relationship with UFC fans. However, his latest act of kindness is a bit hard to ignore. Johnson has had a few different entry points into the UFC, between his presenting of the initial BMF title, to creating the shoes fighters wear during fight week, ...
item.dc:creator: Derek Hall
item.content:encoded:
Dwayne Johnson has had a bit of a complicated relationship with UFC fans. However, his latest act of kindness is a bit hard to ignore.

Johnson has had a few different entry points into the UFC, between his presenting of the initial BMF title, to creating the shoes fighters wear during fight week, and promising a movie about the late, great Mark Kerr that ultimately never came. Throughout these moments, there has been a bit of tension between fans and fighters, and the WWE champ turned Hollywood superstar, with some fighters even publicly speaking out about their dislike for the shoes they are forced to wear.

Dwayne Johnson Offers Help to Themba Gorimbo

Despite this tumultuous history, Dwayne Johnson recently saw an opportunity to help a UFC fighter, and has decided to take it. That fighter would be Zimbabwe born welterweight, Themba Gorimbo.

Following his second UFC fight, a win over Takashi Soto at UFC Vegas 73, reports came out showing Gorimbo admitting to only having $7.49 in his bank account before the fight, surviving on the free meals provided by the UFC on fight week. Seeing this, Johnson took to Twitter to express how much he relates to this story, promising to be in touch with the Zimbabwean.

"This is f‚Äôn crazy to see and brings back many emotions and memories.

$7.49 in this fighter‚Äôs bank account.
I once had $7 bucks too. I‚Äôve been there on that grind.
Got your back, brother. I‚Äôll help.
You got this. I‚Äôll be in touch @TheAnswerMMA
#hardestworkersintheroom" wrote Johnson.

This is f‚Äôn crazy to see and brings back many emotions and memories.
$7.49 in this fighter‚Äôs bank account.
I once had $7 bucks too. I‚Äôve been there on that grind.
Got your back, brother. I‚Äôll help.
You got this. I‚Äôll be in touch @TheAnswerMMA #hardestworkersintheroom https://t.co/C2gn1j7OQF

— Dwayne Johnson (@TheRock) June 10, 2023

Dwayne Johnson has told the story numerous times, about how he started from nothing with only $7 in his acct, even naming his production company Seven Bucks Productions. It will be interesting to see what he does to help out Themba Gorimbo in this similar situation.

  • Read also: African UFC Fighter Speaks Out Against Dricus Du Plessis' Controversial Remarks: 'African Kids Look Up To Adesanya, Not Him'

item.title: Amanda Nunes Warns Irene Aldana Against Imitating Alexa Grasso's Approach Versus Valentina Shevchenko
item.description: UFC Bantamweight Champion Amanda Nunes doesn't think Irene Aldana should mimic Alexa Grasso's style toward an upset. Nunes faces Aldana in the UFC 289 main event later tonight in Vancouver, Canada. She returns to defend the bantamweight title after getting her revenge over Julianna Pe√±a in their ...
item.dc:creator: Curtis Calhoun
item.content:encoded:
UFC Bantamweight Champion Amanda Nunes doesn't think Irene Aldana should mimic Alexa Grasso's style toward an upset.

Nunes faces Aldana in the UFC 289 main event later tonight in Vancouver, Canada. She returns to defend the bantamweight title after getting her revenge over Julianna Pe√±a in their UFC 277 rematch last July.

Aldana is looking to continue to ride the Mexican wave after Grasso pulled off a mammoth upset over Valentina Shevchenko at UFC 285 this past March. Grasso submitted Shevchenko to hand her the first flyweight loss of her career and begin a new era in the division.

Grasso found success against Shevchenko by pressing forward and using her superb boxing technique, but Nunes thinks Aldana should think twice before taking a similar approach on Saturday.

Amanda Nunes: I'll Welcome Irene Aldana's Pressure

During a recent interview with Daniel Cormier, Nunes cautioned Aldana not to take a similar approach as her champion teammate.

"If she runs out to me, I'm gonna land my fresh punch and it's the end," Nunes said. "I don't think she's gonna try to push the pace in the beginning because I'm even more powerful when I'm fresher. If she does that, it's gonna be awesome, because I'm gonna be ready to crack her and go away with my belt.

"But, I don't see that happening. I'm ready for it, but she's technical. She's gonna move, find her way, gonna switch stances... I even expect she'll try to clinch a bit and drain me a little bit," Nunes added.

The "Lioness" made Pe√±a pay for her forward-pushing style at UFC 277. She earned multiple knockdowns to counter Pe√±a's ferocious advances and ended up winning the fight with relative ease.

Aldana, meanwhile, earned the bantamweight title shot after Pe√±a withdrew from UFC 289. She has won four of her last five, including recent victories over Ketlen Vieira and Yana Santos.

If Aldana pulls off the upset this weekend, Nunes thinks it'll have to come from a more measured approach than her title-wielding teammate.

  • Read Also: UFC 289 Sleeper Scrap: Mike Malott vs. Adam Fugitt

Please provide transcription credit with a link to this article if you use any of these quotes.

item.title: UFC 289 Results & Highlights: Amanda Nunes Outworks Irene Aldana
item.description: UFC 289 took place tonight from Rogers Arena in Vancouver, Canada and MMA News has you covered with all the results and highlights!
item.dc:creator: Andrew Starc
item.content:encoded:
UFC 289 took place tonight from Rogers Arena in Vancouver, Canada and MMA News has you covered with all the results and highlights!

In the main event, Amanda Nunes attempted to defend her women's bantamweight crown against top contender Irene Aldana. While in the co-main event, top-five lightweights Charles Oliveira (#1) and Beneil Dariush (#4) collided. 

You can catch all the UFC 289 results and highlights below!

UFC 289 Highlights: MAIN CARD

  • Amanda Nunes def. Irene Aldana via unanimous decision (50-44x2, 50-43)
  • Charles Oliveira def. Beneil Dariush via TKO: R1, 4.10
  • Mike Malott def. Adam Fugitt via submission: R2, 1.06
  • Dan Ige def. Nate Landwehr via unanimous decision (29-28x2, 30-27)
  • Marc-Andre Barriault def. Eryk Anders via unanimous decision (30-27x3)

PRELIMINARY CARD

  • Chris Curtis vs. Nassourdine Imavov ends in no contest (accidental headbutt): R2, 3.04
  • Jasmine Jasudavicius def. Miranda Maverick (29-28x3)
  • Aiemann Zahabi def. Aori Qileng via KO: R1, 1.04
  • Kyle Nelson def. Blake Bilder via unanimous decision (30-27x2, 29-28)

EARLY PRELIMINARY CARD

  • Stephen Erceg def. David Dvorak via unanimous decision (29-28x2, 30-27)
  • Diana Belbita def. Maria Oliveira via unanimous decision (30-27x2, 29-28)

Preliminary Card Highlights

Aiemann Zahabi def. Aori Qileng

Aiemann Zahabi earned the first finish of UFC 289 by sensationally knocking out Aori Qileng in just over a minute.

ZAHABI'S HUGE LEFT LED TO THE FIRST ROUND KO üëä #UFC289 pic.twitter.com/H2ujHW6B15

— ESPN MMA (@espnmma) June 11, 2023

Main Card Highlights

Marc-Andre Barriault def. Eryk Anders

In this middleweight bout, Canada's Marc-Andre Barriault earned a unanimous decision victory over Eryk Anders.

In round one, Barriault sent Anders to the canvas with a crushing right, but the American recovered to land brutal elbows and strikes. Round two saw Anders push the pace, with both fighters having success on the feet. In round three, Barriault put it on Anders with a series of blistering combinations and jabs to get the win.

Barriault dropped Anders early üò≥ #UFC289 pic.twitter.com/3KmzcuAxCX

— ESPN MMA (@espnmma) June 11, 2023

Two in a row for Barriault!@PowerBarriault takes the decision on home soil üá®üá¶ #UFC289 pic.twitter.com/VYRlGpPc8b

— UFC (@ufc) June 11, 2023

Dan Ige def. Nate Landwehr

In this featherweight bout, Dan Ige earned a unanimous decision against Nate Landwehr.

Round one saw both fighters have success on the feet, with Ige landing a huge left late on that sent Landwehr to the canvas. Round two saw Ige yet again send Landwehr to the canvas with a massive left late on, and almost put him away with ground strikes. In round three, Ige wobbled Landwehr with a stiff left early, but Landwehr responded with some savage elbows in the clinch.

IGE DROPS LANDWEHR TO THE GROUND AGAIN üëä #UFC289 pic.twitter.com/mnx0s6fJhN

— ESPN MMA (@espnmma) June 11, 2023

Unanimous for 50K Ige! üëè@Dynamitedan808 takes the decision over Nate Landwehr at #UFC289 pic.twitter.com/whQ4Opmsst

— UFC (@ufc) June 11, 2023

Mike Malott def. Adam Fugitt

In this welterweight bout, Mike Malott earned yet another finish by submitting Adam Fugitt.

Round one saw Mallott trouble Fugitt with a series of brutal body kicks and land a takedown. Then early in round two, the Canadian sent Fugitt to the canvas with a massive left hook, before locking in a guillotine to force the tap. 

MIKE MALOTT GETS THE SUBMISSION WIN FOR THE HOME CROWD üá®üá¶ #UFC289 pic.twitter.com/o7AG5E3l1e

— ESPN MMA (@espnmma) June 11, 2023

Charles Oliveira def. Beneil Dariush

In the co-main event, Charles Oliveira made a case for another lightweight title shot by earning a sensational first-round TKO of Beneil Dariush. Catch all the highlights below.

An emotional entrance for Charles Oliveira üôå #UFC289 pic.twitter.com/HWSVOIHc1R

— ESPN MMA (@espnmma) June 11, 2023

Oliveira finishes Dariush in Round 1 üò≥ #UFC289 pic.twitter.com/cy8uiZ3wLz

— ESPN MMA (@espnmma) June 11, 2023

Scenes in Vancouver!!

Charles Oliveira takes to the crowd #UFC289 pic.twitter.com/Owfom45fX0

— UFC (@ufc) June 11, 2023

üö® Charles Oliveira speaks English alert üö® #UFC289 pic.twitter.com/t3ojEwnhkQ

— UFC (@ufc) June 11, 2023

Amanda Nunes def. Irene Aldana

In the main event, Amanda Nunes defended her women's bantamweight title with a dominant unanimous decision victory over Irene Aldana. And following the decision, the widely-touted women's MMA GOAT announced her retirement from the sport.

A very cagey round one saw Nunes push the pace, but Aldana landed a counter right hook that stunned the Brazilian. In round two, Nunes continued to dominate, landing at will and scoring multiple takedowns. Round three saw Nunes easily get the takedown and land a flurry of savage strikes late on.

In round four, Nunes continued to have her way, landing a variety of savage strikes including a spinning backfist. And in the final round, Nunes got the takedown and dominated on top for the rest of the round. Catch all the highlights below.

IT. IS. TIME. #UFC289 pic.twitter.com/VgbbCisrQd

— ESPN MMA (@espnmma) June 11, 2023

We're headed to championship rounds!

What are those scorecards looking like? #UFC289 pic.twitter.com/vhfzj9TV2E

— UFC (@ufc) June 11, 2023

The Lioness DOMINATES all 5 rounds in this one ü¶Å #UFC289 pic.twitter.com/7dEyFi5C3v

— UFC (@ufc) June 11, 2023

"And Still forever! Double champion for life!"@Amanda_Leoa calls it a career at #UFC289 pic.twitter.com/6kdifaFGhw

— UFC (@ufc) June 11, 2023

item.title: ONE Fight Night 11 Results & Highlights: Regian Eersel Stops Dmitry Menshikov In 46 Seconds
item.description: After a memorable debut in the United States last month, ONE Championship's latest Prime Video card back on Asian soil is in the books, and it delivered some more memorable action. For the third time, the Asian promotion staged a ONE Fight Night card from the iconic Lumpinee Boxing Stadium in ...
item.dc:creator: Harvey Leonard
item.content:encoded:
After a memorable debut in the United States last month, ONE Championship's latest Prime Video card back on Asian soil is in the books, and it delivered some more memorable action.

For the third time, the Asian promotion staged a ONE Fight Night card from the iconic Lumpinee Boxing Stadium in Bangkok, Thailand.

In addition to its weekly 'Friday Fights' series, the organization has brought blockbuster title matchups, with Nong-O Hama vs. Jonathan Haggerty and John Lineker vs. Fabr√≠cio Andrade taking place at the famed venue. At ONE Fight Night 11, two world championships were on the line.

Topping the card was two-sport champion Regian Eersel, who is the owner of both the Muay Thai and kickboxing lightweight titles. The Immortal" put his gold in the "art of eight limbs" on the line, decimating challenger Dmitry Menshikov of Russia, who saw his six-year unbeaten run ended in just 46 seconds against the Surinamese-Dutch 'champ-champ'.

üî• FIGHT DAY üî• Your final bout card for ONE Fight Night 11 on Prime Video, headlined by two World Title blockbusters! ü§© Tune in at 8PM ET/5PM PT for all the action!#ONEFightNight11 | Friday at 8PM ET/5PM PT
üá∫üá∏üá®üá¶ WATCH LIVE on Prime üëâ https://t.co/4ImwmrDHNi
üåç Live TV‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/WbMam3FYxF

— ONE Championship (@ONEChampionship) June 9, 2023

Before the lightweight Muay Thai practitioners took to the ring, there were championship stakes in a different realm, with reigning ONE Lightweight Submission Grappling Champion Kade Ruotolo successfully defending his title for the second time in a competitive contest against fellow Brazilian jiu-jitsu specialist Tommy Langaker that went the distance.

In another notable bout, former ONE featherweight kickboxing champion Superbon Singha Mawynn returned to action for the first time since losing the title via knockout against Chingiz Allazov this past January at ONE Fight Night 6. The Thai star staked his claim for a shot at redemption against "Chinga" by brutally knocking out Tayfun √ñzcan with a first-round head kick.

See below for the full ONE Fight Night 11 results, followed by the highlights!

  • Bantamweight MMA: Kwon Won Il def. Artem Balakh via TKO: R2, 3:57
  • Catchweight (129.25lbs) Muay Thai: Martine Michieletto def. Amber Kitchen via unanimous decision
  • Flyweight MMA: Hu Yong def. Woo Sung Hoon via split decision

item.title: Video: Superbon Rebounds From Title Loss, Brutally Sleeps Tayfun √ñzcan With Head Kick At ONE Fight Night 11
item.description: On June 9, ONE Championship staged its latest ONE Fight Night card from the iconic Lumpinee Boxing Stadium in Bangkok, Thailand. The event marked the promotion's 11th to air on Amazon Prime Video, and North American viewers who tuned in for the first time via the streaming platform were treated to ...
item.dc:creator: Harvey Leonard
item.content:encoded:
On June 9, ONE Championship staged its latest ONE Fight Night card from the iconic Lumpinee Boxing Stadium in Bangkok, Thailand.

The event marked the promotion's 11th to air on Amazon Prime Video, and North American viewers who tuned in for the first time via the streaming platform were treated to some memorable action.

And topping the list in that regard was Superbon Singha Mawynn, who is widely regard as one of the pound-for-pound best kickboxers on the planet.

The 32-year-old Pattalung native entered 2023 with ONE's featherweight kickboxing gold in his possession and riding a 12-fight winning run, the final three victories of which came against a trio of top five-ranked athletes in Sitthichai Sitsongpeenong, Giorgio Petrosyan, and Marat Grigorian.

But at ONE Fight Night 6 this past January, Superbon was dethroned in dramatic fashion by Belarusian-Azerbaijani kickboxer Chingiz Allazov, who recorded two knockdowns before sleeping the Thai star with a vicious right hand.

On Friday, Superbon was back in his nation's capital in pursuit of a quick rebound performance. And to say he was successful in achieving that goal would be an understatement...

Superbon KO's √ñzcan With Lightning-Quick Head Kick

In his pursuit of a rematch with "Chinga," Superbon was tasked with defending his #1 spot in the featherweight kickboxing rankings opposite #5 contender Tayfun √ñzcan of Turkey and the Netherlands.

While "The Turbine" found a home with his hooks early into proceedings, his Thai counterpart repeatedly fired back with his classic, rapid offense, looking to set up his powerful head kick.

Just one minute and 46 seconds into the very first round, Superbon landed it ‚Äî and it resulted in a lifeless √ñzcan crashing to the canvas.

Superbon üáπüá≠ puts Tayfun Ozcan OUT with an INSANE head kick KO! ü§Ø

Tune in to Prime Video NOW to catch the rest of ONE Fight Night 11!#ONEFightNight11 | LIVE NOW
üá∫üá∏üá®üá¶ WATCH LIVE on Prime üëâ https://t.co/4ImwmrEfCQ
üåç Live TV broadcast in 170+ countries (check local listings)
üåç‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/OzJcPERuoH

— ONE Championship (@ONEChampionship) June 10, 2023

With that, Superbon has returned to the winner's circle and maintained his status as the #1-ranked featherweight kickboxer competing in Asia's premier martial arts organization.

And in his post-fight interview, during which he had a $50,000 performance bonus confirmed, the Thai star firmly expressed his plans by calling for a rematch with Allazov.

With the champ scheduled to share the Circle with Grigorian at ONE Fight Night 13 on August 4, it stands to reason that Superbon will be keeping a close eye on that contest ahead of a possible clash with the victor.

  • Read Also: ONE Fight Night 11: Regian Eersel vs. Dmitry Menshikov Live Results & Highlights

item.content:encoded:
UFC President Dana White has shut the door on the rumored Kamaru Usman vs. Khamzat Chimaev fight talks.

Usman and Chimaev have been linked to a potential fight for weeks. Both fighters are shooting for returns by the end of the year, with Chimaev targeting a return for the Abu Dhabi card in October.

Chimaev hasn't fought since a win over Kevin Holland in the UFC 279 co-headliner last year. He's hinted at a move to middleweight, although it's uncertain if he'll follow through amidst rumors of a welterweight run.

Usman is looking to get back on track after falling to Leon Edwards in their trilogy at UFC 286. But, it appears it won't be against Chimaev.

According to TSN's Aaron Bronsteter, White told him that the UFC has other plans for both fighters.

According to Dana White, the rumours of a bout between Khamzat Chimaev and Kamaru Usman are "bullshit".

— Aaron Bronsteter (@aaronbronsteter) June 9, 2023

Dana White: Kamaru Usman vs. Khamzat Chimaev Talks Are "Bulls***"

White didn't elaborate on the exact bookings targeted for both Usman and Chimaev.

Edwards is expected to face Colby Covington for his next welterweight title defense later this year. The fight hasn't been formally announced, but White has remained adamant about making it the next title matchup.

Usman vs. Chimaev would've put two of the top fighters in the UFC against each other. Usman would also have the opportunity to test Chimaev's wrestling, which has looked unflappable so far during his tenure with the promotion.

But, it appears that Usman vs. Chimaev is simply a 'what if', and the UFC could announce their plans for both athletes in the coming months.

  • Read Also: Watch: Amanda Nunes vs. Irene Aldana, Charles Oliveira vs. Beneil Dariush Final UFC 289 Faceoffs

item.title: Watch: Amanda Nunes vs. Irene Aldana, Charles Oliveira vs. Beneil Dariush Final UFC 289 Faceoffs

UFC Bantamweight Champion Amanda Nunes returns to defend the belt against the surging Irene Aldana. Nunes reclaimed the title by defeating Julianna Pe√±a at UFC 277. ...
item.dc:creator: Curtis Calhoun
item.content:encoded:
The UFC 289 main event and co-main event fighters came face-to-face for a final time before the fighting festivities on Saturday.

UFC Bantamweight Champion Amanda Nunes returns to defend the belt against the surging Irene Aldana. Nunes reclaimed the title by defeating Julianna Pe√±a at UFC 277.

Nunes and Pe√±a were scheduled to meet in a trilogy at UFC 289 before Pe√±a withdrew due to a rib injury. Aldana, a winner of four of her last five, got the call to step up and fight for the title.

Aldana has looked impressive during her UFC tenure, earning wins over the likes of Ketlen Vieira and Macy Chiasson. Her forward-pushing boxing style has proven to give her opponents headaches inside the Octagon.

The UFC 289 co-main event features a highly-anticipated lightweight clash between Charles Oliveira and Beneil Dariush. The winner could potentially earn themselves the next lightweight title shot.

Oliveira is looking for redemption after falling to Islam Makhachev at UFC 280 last October. Before the loss, he won 11 straight fights, including a vacant title win over Michael Chandler at UFC 262.

Dariush has been on a roll with eight straight wins, including victories over Mateusz Gamrot and Tony Ferguson. He's searching for his long-awaited shot at UFC gold.

Check out the main and co-main event faceoffs at the UFC 289 Ceremonial Weigh-Ins in Vancouver.

UFC 289 Main & Co-Main Event Final Faceoffs

Amanda Nunes vs. Irene Aldana

The bantamweight title‚Äôs on the line tomorrow!! üèÜ@Amanda_Leoa defends her throne against @IreneAldana_ at #UFC289!

— UFC (@ufc) June 9, 2023

Charles Oliveira vs. Beneil Dariush

Two of the world‚Äôs best lightweights meet TOMORROW!@CharlesDoBronxs vs @BeneilDariush in our #UFC289 co-main!

[ 10pmET / 7pmPT | Live on @ESPNPlus PPV ] pic.twitter.com/hw7Q2GggWW

— UFC (@ufc) June 9, 2023
